page.title: 01Kirk & its surrounding area
page.content: The landscape is noticeable without trees, small areas have been cultivated into farms, but the rest is moorland, of which some has been used for peat cutting and the rest for the common grazing of sheep. The people who live in the area ae mainly farmers Most of the farms have been in the same family for several generations. Originally the land was divided into the square fields of the crofting system, and still the old croft houses can be seen, but now they are in ruins. Many of the old houses were bult of local stone from the nwo disused quarry, and some of the out-buildings had walsl and floors made from whole pieces of Carthness flagstones. There is a strong community spirit, everyone helping out at harvest time etc.
